direction.raw_text: . WE HAVE COMPANY.

direction.raw_text: ? Suddenly -- WHOMMPPPH!! -- the skydiver spread-eagles, stopping the wild dive directly behind Pasqual, and immediately binds his arms and straps a parachute on him. All three are still free-falling. James Earl Jones nods at the Skydiver who, even under the helmet and goggles, is clearly a beautiful woman. Meet ALEXANDRA "ALEX" MUNDAY, one of Charlie's Angels. She's a sultry bombshell -- a classic femme fatale -- only she's playing for the good guys. She gives James Earl Jones a wink, then jerks Pasqual's rip cord and -- WHOOMPH. Pasqual's chute deploys. He flies upward, leaving -- Alex and James Earl Jones, both still falling.    Below the ocean screams up at them. Not much time left. James Earl Jones pulls his belt -- and his mufti flies up. It's actually a tiny drogue chute, deploying his entire dashiki. His outfit hides a parachute rig. Alex pulls her own rip cord and -- WHOOMPH -- her chute unfurls, and now... Alex and James Earl Jones gently float towards -- EXT. THE BIG BLUE SEA - DAY A cigarette boat floats through the choppy water, a gorgeous young woman expertly throttling up the growling V-8. Say hello to NATALIE THOMPSON, Charlie's second angel. At a glance, she's the brainy-shy girl next door. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                 5. CONTINUED: But put her behind the wheel of any vehicle, and she's unstoppable. Natalie glances ahead, maneuvering the boat perfectly under Alex, who drops on deck. Alex gathers her chute, then whips off her helmet to give her cascading mane a wild shake. Here comes James Earl Jones. Natalie guns the boat underneath...a perfect catch. Alex helps him with his dashiki-chute, and then all three look up... Here comes Pasqual. Natalie whips the boat around, catching him as he helplessly drops into the seats, still bound, still scared out of his wits. He gapes wild-eyed at the two Angels, then whirls on James Earl Jones.

direction.raw_text: Well, Angels, the experimental explosives are back in the hands of the government, and the free world can breathe just a lit-tle bit easier tonight, thanks to you three. These are three very different girls. NATALIE, with a page-boy cut and wearing a Catholic schoolgirl's uniform, sports glasses and braces; a bit awkward and gangly, even shy. ALEX, formally dressed with perfect pig-tails, is sophisticated and self-possessed; a class act, even at ten. DYLAN, wild blond hair and faded T-shirt, has a jaded, street-wise smirk; even at this young age, her isolation and disillusionment are masked by seeming confidence.

direction.raw_text: ... there were three very different little girls. The triptych remains on screen. NATALIE, a research fellow at MIT (and beautiful, but not flaunting it) demonstrates a chess-playing computer program to a room of impressed advisors. ALEX, valedictorian at Oxford, passionately delivers her address to a crowd of rapt students, faculty and parents. DYLAN, in leather and a helmet, steps off a Harley. She sees a punk with a mohawk slapping around his girlfriend. She decks him, then enters the back door of a seedy punk bar.

He's wearing two towels: one around his waist, and a second around his chest. As more steam dissipates, we see there    are SEVEN MEN sitting on the risers. Six are gorgeous, ranging     from Calvin Klein models to Marlboro Men. Bosley looks around,     taking a keen interest. Maybe he's checking them out, maybe he    isn't. We just don't know. The seventh man is ROGER CORWIN, who we recognize from the videotape. He's leaning forward, a gold chain dangling. It's beside him that Bosley takes a seat. He sets the ice cup -- and the transmitter -- in a strategic location. Noticing that none of the other men have towels around their bosoms, Bosley nervously undoes his, revealing skin the color of cooked salmon. He fluffs up his sparse chest hair, then decides to smush it back down. He tries to make eye contact with Corwin, working way too hard. Annoyed, Corwin finally looks over.

We just see a bit of ass, but Bosley is face- to-face with the babymaker. One ice chip is not going to do it.    He chugs the rest of his cup, including THE TRANSMITTER which BLEEPS.    Corwin and others look over.    What the hell was that? The device still in his mouth, Bosley has no choice but to smile and swallow. His eyes go wide as he chokes it down. Corwin gets up to leave.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, I saw the way he looked at you. One motorcycle charges, coming up just feet from the windshield. Natalie taps on the brakes. The freaked out guy can't slow down in time. He SMACKS into the windshield, then goes flying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're at the bottom! Indeed, we are. The concrete walls end, leaving open ground. Slamming on the brakes, Natalie turns the van around. Everyone goes flying. Bosley is still on the phone with Charlie. EXT. BASE OF THE MOUNTAIN - NIGHT Back facing the right direction, the van charges onward. The motorcycles race up to the passenger side, grabbing for the door. INT. THE VAN - NIGHT Dylan SLAMS open the door, knocking one RIDER off. The sliding door opens, another RIDER outside trying to get in. Thinking fast, Knox grabs Bosley's tuba and shoves it at the motorcyclist, who tumbles, taking out the fourth rider in the process.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex leans forward from the second row.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that went very well. Charlie should send me on more missions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We couldn't have done it without you, Bos. Natalie pats him on the arm. She and Alex exchange a quick glance. They have to just laugh. In the back row, Knox is looking out over the gorgeous lights of Aspen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cocktail? She offers him an airplane-sized bottle of Johnnie Walker black. He takes it and toasts. They both down their drinks in a single shot. A smile, and then... MUSIC rises. THE ANGELS TRIPTYCH descends. The act is over.    After a beat, we WIPE TO REVEAL: EXT. CHARLES TOWNSEND DETECTIVE AGENCY - DAY Re-establishing. INT. CHARLES TOWNSEND DETECTIVE AGENCY - (THE NEXT) DAY Charlie is on the speakerphone.      The angels are in their usual lounging positions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good work, Angels. Not only did you save Knox, you saved his company as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that earns us a vacation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say, Fiji? (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                 43. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any special guy you were thinking of inviting? Natalie grins a guilty smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Angels.     Our work is only half-done. Knox enters. Clean-shaven and neatly pressed, he's still a darn good-looking man. Vivian Wu follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meet your new client, Eric Knox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First off, thank you. You rescued me, for which I am eternally grateful. He's talking to all the angels, but his gaze seems to fall most upon Dylan. She notices it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there's still a problem. Whoever kidnapped me wasn't just trying to screw up our IPO. They also stole the proprietary software for our new web browser. I'm sure it was Roger Corwin, but I need proof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's where you come in, Angels. CIRCLING AROUND, we see the video images of Corwin and the Red Star Systems logo on the big screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to break into Red Star's computer systems to see if Mr. Knox's software is indeed being converted for Red Star's use.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like a plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not as easy as that, Natalie. Red Star's headquarters are as tightly guarded as a military facility. We're going to need reconnaissance on their mainframe computer system, and the best way to get that is through Mr. Corwin himself. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                 44. CONTINUED: A video image of Corwin's Palm Pilot Schedule comes up the bigscreen. The shot pulls in close on "SAN DIEGO SPEEDWAY."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to pin a camera on him to get footage of the inside of the building. Thanks to Alex's work at the health spa, we know that Corwin will be at the San Diego Speedway on Thursday. Get close to him Angels, but don't tip your hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consider it done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dylan, I need you to arrange for Mr. Knox's security. I'd hate to have him kidnapped again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely. But we'd all feel safer if you could join us, Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three manta-rays swim above us. We can hear the BUBBLES from Charlie's regulator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd love to Angels. But I'm in a bit over my head at the moment. A manta-ray swims past, super-close, letting us...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're good. He moves to help her down, but she does a reverse-pullup to handle it by herself. She leads the way... INT. KNOX'S BEDROOM - DUSK The room is huge. Through the floor-to-ceiling windows, we see that we're up in the hills. Knox follows her as she walks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got surveillance on all the windows. Don't answer the door, don't answer the phone. We continue... INT. KNOX LIVING ROOM - DUSK Just as big, just as beautiful. Knox, or his decorator, has great taste. Everything is top quality, but unpretentious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Also, stay away from the windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're bullet-proof.   The last owner was paranoid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucky for us. She takes a marker-sized device off the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a panic button. (tosses it to him) Press it and one of us can be here in ten minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one of you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoever's closest. She takes her jacket off the couch, ready to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a better idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                 46. CONTINUED: He tosses her the panic button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay for dinner. (preempting objections) I'm a pretty good cook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't Mr. Knox. I'm sorry.     If you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm scared. Dylan is surprised by this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I didn't want to admit it, but I am. I was kidnapped once, and it wasn't fun. I know, you probably have other plans, but it would be very reassuring. Dylan looks him over. Normally, she'd be suspicious, but the guy WAS just kidnapped, and he seems sincere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, don't make me beg. I'm embarrassed already. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be. She throws her coat back on the sofa. INT. KNOX LIVING ROOM - NIGHT We PAN OFF a half-played Scrabble game to find Dylan and Knox at the windows. Dylan picks up a family photo, Knox as a little boy with a father in a military uniform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's you, hunh? Cute kid.    Cute family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. (taking the photo) It's the only picture I have of me with my parents. They died a week later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.   Oh, I'm sorry. I had no idea... (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                 47. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, don't apologize. I was too young to understand. (looking at the photo) I never knew how they died. When I was a kid, when I got shuffled from one foster home to another, I always thought they just disappeared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only found out later, my father was in the military. He and my mother were killed while he was on assignment, somewhere in Eastern Europe. (mostly to himself) The files were classified, but I read enough to know that he was a good man. Apparently, he was betrayed by one of his own team.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow.   That's a lot for a kid to live with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but it motivated me, losing my family. It still does. I don't take anything for granted. Dylan nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy did I have you pegged wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, to be honest, I thought you were a rich kid who inherited everything. But that's pretty typical. I've got instincts for the job, but when it comes to men? Well...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you don't see me as just a client. He brushes his hand against hers.     She brushes back, fingers against fingers. A long beat. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                   48. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.   Well, you ARE, so...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there someone you need to be going home to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. (beat) But I... He kisses her. After a moment, she breaks off. It's not that it was a bad kiss. It was a damn good kiss. It's just...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I shouldn't. Knox moves towards her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't you? Dylan holds him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   I shouldn't. She stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you for dinner, Mr. Knox.    And lock the door behind me. She gets up and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FORMULA-ONE RACE CARS ROARING past on the track.       It's all thunder, smoke and asphalt. We are... EXT. SAN DIEGO SPEEDWAY - DAY With a ROAR, another blur of racers whips past, with heat and noise and speed. The lead car bears the familiar markings of RED STAR INDUSTRIES. Roger Corwin is at the wheel, steering calmly to a comfortable lead, when he is suddenly BUMPED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the...? (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                  49. CONTINUED: ANOTHER BUMP sends him screeching to the left. He almost crashes, then gets back on course, just as he's passed by... A SLEEK, BLACK CAR, sponsored by the SONY CORPORATION, and manned by a mysterious driver with TEXAS TORNADO inscripted on the helmet. We follow the black car as it pulls into the pit. EXT. FREEWAY PIT - DAY The racer pulls off her helmet as the pit crew surrounds her. Of course, the racer is Natalie, aka BETTY LOU HOBERT, the Texas Tornado.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: HERE'S AN OUTLINE OF WHAT WILL HAPPEN IN THE REST OF THIS SCENE

dialogue.raw_text: : CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                42. HELICOPTER thunders over.    We are... INT. THE HELICOPTER - NIGHT Natalie is at the controls, Bosley beside her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : UNDERWATER From Charlie's P.O.V., looking up at the sunlight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. KNOX HOUSE - DUSK A majestic craftsman in the hills, Frank Lloyd Wright meets conspicuous consumption. INT. KNOX HOUSE ATTIC - DUSK A flashlight beam sweeps past, revealing Dylan. With just her shoulders above the rafters, she's checking a dusty crawl space. She finds nothing suspicious. INT. KNOX'S WALK-IN CLOSET - DUSK Knox stands below, Dylan's boots on his shoulders. The heels dig in a bit, but he's not complaining. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                45. CONTINUED:
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! (beat)
direction.name: direction

result.ToD: CAN'T BELIEVE YOU'VE NEVER RACED THIS TRACK BEFORE
result.heading: CAN'T BELIEVE YOU'VE NEVER RACED THIS TRACK BEFORE
THIS ALL'S A PIECE A CAKE

direction.raw_text: ! THIS ALL'S A PIECE A CAKE! Natalie shakes out her hair, winks at the pit boss. The Pit Crew races in to make repairs. DYLAN, dressed in a pit suit, kneels by Natalie's front tire. Natalie crouches down next to her so they can talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I nicked him. Should give you enough time to do the deed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm on it. Dylan steals away, heading for... CORWIN'S PIT CREW -- Corwin is seething mad as he pulls into his pit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !    WE'RE LOSING TIME HERE! The pit repairs his car as Corwin is approached by another racer, also wearing a Red Star racing suit. He leans into Corwin's car and now we see that's it's... THE THIN MAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay, Boss? (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                   50. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thanks to you! You're supposed to be my head of security! Who is that bitch?! The Thin Man peers over at Natalie, but she's got her back to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know.   I'll keep an eye out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.   You do that. Corwin peels out onto the track again, almost crushing the Thin Man in the process. AS CORWIN PULLS OUT Dylan sneaks in. In all the cacophony, no one notices as she grabs CORWIN'S SUITCASE out of the back seat of his regular car, a bitching Mercedes. She checks both ways to see if she's being watched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coast is clear, Dylan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. THE WINNER'S CIRCLE Where Alex, dressed as a trophy girl, watches the race through binoculars and keeps an eye on her pals. She nods to BOSLEY, who is dressed as the Flag Waver. He speaks into a walkie talkie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's make the switch. BACK IN THE PIT -- Dylan pulls a briefcase out of her jumpsuit, and swaps it with one in Corwin's car. She carefully switches all his files from the old briefcase to the new one, then gives Alex a thumbs up. MEANWHILE BACK IN THE RACE -- NATALIE roars back onto the track, keeping Corwin in her sights. Then she spots another Red Star car, coming up right next to her. She locks eyes with the Thin Man. The two of them recognize each other at the exact same instant. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                  51. CONTINUED: The Thin Man, realizing he's been made, jams on the brakes and skids off to the right, which leads to a ramp that heads out of the stadium. Natalie, not wanting to lose him, does something crazy. Even though she's at the front of the pack, she brakes hard, swerves into a full 180 degree U-turn, and starts heading the WRONG WAY on the race track. Startled drivers pull off to the left and right as she follows the Thin Man out of the racetrack. EXT. SPEEDWAY ACCESS ROAD - DAY To a chorus of CAR HORNS, the Thin Man's blue racer weaves through the spectator traffic entering the speedway. Looking back, we see Natalie is gaining on him. Finally clear of the traffic, both cars let it rip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're just joining us, we're approaching hour five of a pursuit that has lead us all across the Southland, at speeds up to 80 miles an hour. A beat-up gray Chrysler leads a phalanx of police cars down the empty freeway. It's oddly calm and hypnotizing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chuck, time and again we hear the question, "Why don't the police just ram the other car, or shoot out the tires?" The LAPD has a policy of hanging back and following unless... Suddenly, the blue Formula One car comes screeching past the cops and the suspect, over 200 miles per hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that? INT. NATALIE'S RED CAR / ON THE FREEWAY - DAY Still hot on the Thin Man's tail, Natalie has the engine ROARING. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                               52. CONTINUED: As she passes the police cars, we see several OFFICERS look over -- what the hell? Natalie catches up to the gray Chrysler. Looks over to see the WILD-EYED SUSPECT, hunched over the wheel. He looks back at her. A beat later, she's passed him, just taillights on the freeway. EXT. FREEWAY - DAY With the lanes cleared for the other chase, there is nothing preventing the Formula One cars from hitting top speed -- which they do. Natalie is catching up to the Thin Man. As they head under an overpass, we see KIDS CHEERING. INT. BLUE CAR - DAY The Thin Man checks his gauges. The gas dial is perilously close to empty -- these cars are meant to be refilled often. Up ahead, he sees an exit.   He starts to slow down... EXT. FREEWAY - DAY ... but when you're going 200 miles per hour, that can take a while. He misses the exit. Natalie is trying to match his speed. The Thin Man pulls over to the side, stops fully. Braking as hard as she can, Natalie still passes him. The Thin Man throws a U-turn, heading up the freeway on-ramp. Natalie follows. EXT. SAN DIEGO SHIPYARD - DAY We catch glimpses behind fences and between train cars -- the two racers gliding slowly down the narrow roads, like lions pacing. INT. NATALIE'S RED CAR - DAY Pulling off her helmet, Natalie scans right and left for the blue car -- she's lost sight of him. The narrow windshields of these racers doesn't make it any easier. EXT. SHIPYARD - DAY We LOOK DOWN on Natalie's car as she rounds a corner, still searching. CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                               53. EXT. PIER - DAY Natalie spots the blue racer reaching the end of the long pier. It pulls a U-turn to face her, then stops, engine idling. There's only way off the pier, and it's past Natalie. The Thin Man REVS his engine. Natalie REVS hers. ANGLE ON a white seagull, pecking at something on the pier, halfway between the two racers. The bird looks up, hearing the engines. ANGLE ON the Thin Man. He pulls his harness tighter. REVS his engine higher. ANGLE ON Natalie. If it's a game of chicken he wants, she'll give it to him. She REVS her engine higher still. The noise scares the bird, who suddenly flies off. Like a flag being dropped, that's the signal for both racers to peel out. A cloud of SMOKE.    Rubber on asphalt. Already reaching a tremendous speed, the racers are on a collision course. The Thin Man isn't going to turn away. Neither is Natalie. Racing faster, and faster still, there's only one way this can turn out. But then, at the very last moment, the Thin Man wusses out. He cuts the wheel right, missing Natalie and careening off the edge of the pier. In SLOW MOTION, we watch as his racer hangs in mid-air, wheels still spinning. Back-heavy, the tail hits the water first. Natalie brakes hard, cuts the wheel to avoid going off the far end of the pier. She finally stops, the rear tire just 1/4 inch from the edge. CRANING UP along the side of the pier, we find Natalie looking into the water where the blue racer went in. There's just a slick of oil and a steady stream of bubbles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There! VIDEO FREEZES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the room with the mainframe. Everything at Red Star goes through that system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So if we want to find proof that Red Star stole Knox's technology, that's the computer to tap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. But they have heavy firewalls and encryption. You can't jack in from outside. You'll have to physically be in that room to get at the data.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even if we do get inside, there won't be time to search for it. There's got to be a hundred terabytes of information there. It could take days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you install a transmitter. All eyes go over to Natalie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patch in directly to the relay, broadcast on a high frequency. That way, you can have access to the mainframe from the comfort of your own home. And they have no idea that you can peek inside. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                               55. CONTINUED: Knox is impressed.    The other angels nod.   It's a good idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all fine in theory. But you still have to get inside that room to install it. What about security?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Red Star has a lot of Government contracts, so security is tight. Key- card badges throughout. Redundant security at all red-line areas with biometric scanners and weekly keycodes. Pervasive video surveillance, lasers, air-displacement sensors. Plus a hard- wired fail-safe at the relay to prevent exactly this kind of tapping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sounds impossible. Alex checks with her fellow angels.    They're in agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sounds like fun. With a subtle RUSH, we move into a stylized MONTAGE that shows How They Do It. It features WHIP PANS, FREEZE FRAMES and ZOOMS to show us only the highlights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only the two directors can disengage the fail-safe. We have to get their keys. WHIP CUT TO: INT. NUDE NUDE NUDE GIRLS - DAY ANGLE ON DIRECTOR #1, 40's, part of the lunchtime crowd. Alex and Natalie are on the catwalk, in the middle of a grinding routine. Paying for his drink, he fumbles with his wallet. His waitress helps him find the right bill. As she walks away, we see the waitress is Dylan. FREEZE FRAME. We ZOOM IN on the orange key-card she's grabbed from him. EXT. BACK YARD BIRTHDAY PART - DAY ANGLE ON Bosley, done up in full clown makeup. He tries to twist a balloon animal, but no luck. Finally it POPS. The CHILDREN CRY. Entertaining the ADULTS, magician Alex whips open her silk handkerchief to reveal that the "item" has disappeared. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                  56. CONTINUED: ANGLE ON DIRECTOR #2, who looks very worried. Magician's assistant Dylan takes off her giant hat to reveal the director's billfold is underneath. Getting it back, he's relieved. Passing behind Dylan, Natalie takes the orange keycard Dylan hands off. FREEZE FRAME. ZOOM IN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we have to get back into Red Star. Problem is, their biometric sensors are too good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need someone's help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy? You gonna let me through or what? Tommy the Guard looks up, sees Corwin is still at the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.     Yeah, sorry Mr. Corwin. He hits the button again, letting Corwin through. Tommy goes back to his magazine, still a little perplexed. INT. SECURE HALLWAY - DAY The same places we saw on the videotape. Natalie-as- Corwin swipes the two stolen failsafe cards in a reader, sending the lights from red to green. FREEZE FRAME. She splices in a transmitter the size of a cigarette pack. Pulls up a tiny antenna. FREEZE FRAME. INT. SECURE HALLWAY - DAY Corwin walks down the hall, still talking with his colleague. Natalie-as-Corwin is walking right towards them. She turns away as she passes. He didn't even spot her. She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's done. Red Star's mainframe is open for business. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                  58. CONTINUED: Astonished, Vivian Wu hits some keys, checking that what they say is true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Champagne, please. Your best. Smiling, Knox motions for them to take a seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I know why I hired you.   You're the best. A look between the angels.      They know it's true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have Systems get to work on this right away. She reaches for the laptop.      Bosley snatches it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, actually Miss Wu, WE will get to work on this right away. Any evidence we find will be turned over to you AND the proper authorities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think you understand how important that data is, Mr...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, indeed I do. And that's why I'll take very good care of it when I find it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vivian, please. Do as the man says. Reluctantly, Vivian Wu pulls her hand away. Bosley tucks the laptop into a steel briefcase, then stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you off to, Bos?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vacation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh oh, lemme guess. You're off to chase bikinis at some tropical resort? (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                  59. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly!   Fire Island, here I come! Dylan does a spit take, the other two Angels roll their eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, Angels. Mr. Knox. (coldly) Ms. Wu. As Bosley exits the restaurant, Vivian Wu eyes him carefully. Knox raises a glass to toast the Angels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More champagne?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have to go.   Plans tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too. As they get up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you? She notices the other Angels staring at her.        She doesn't answer at first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... well... Natalie quickly picks up what's going on.        She glances at Alex, then clears her throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Dylan, can we talk to you for a second? THE LADIES ROOM Natalie, Alex, and Dylan kibbitz near the sinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something going on between you and Knox. Isn't there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what, so I like him.   Is that so wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, yeah Dylan, it IS.    He's a client. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                     60. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a client.    We finished the job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's got a point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? She doesn't have ANY point, Alex, I can't believe you're siding with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not siding with anyone, but technically, he is no longer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know Charlie would NEVER approve of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh come on, Charlie wouldn't care. I think you're just being overly cautious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, guys?   GUYS! They turn to look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a big girl. I make my own decisions. I'm going out with him. She walks out of the ladies' room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. PARKING GARAGE / BEVERLY HILLS - DAY Bosley hums "In the Navy" to himself as he walks through a parking garage. He's alone in the echo-y garage, and everything we know about movies tells us This Means Trouble. BWEEP BWEEP as his alarm shuts off. Just as he's about to lift the handle, he stops. Looks back over his shoulder. Did he hear something? He scans the empty garage.         No one in sight. Must've been his imagination. INT. BOSLEY'S MERCEDES - DAY Bosley climbs in, shutting the door behind him.        He's putting the keys in the ignition, when... A HAND clamps a chloroformed rag over his mouth. It's the Thin Man. Bosley struggles, but in moments, he's unconscious. CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                61. OUTSIDE THE CAR THE THIN MAN stuffs Bosley in the trunk, slams it shut, revealing...

direction.raw_text: Sweet dreams. Vivian Wu, standing beside the Thin Man. She's holding the case Bosley refused to give her before.

direction.raw_text: Hmmm. Miami Arena.    Preparations have been made?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.    We move out tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent. (beat) Where IS Bosley?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the tower. We were waiting till you gave the word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well?    No time like the present. The Thin Man nods. INT. KNOX COMPOUND - DAY The Thin Man cocks his gun as he heads to the tower to do away with Bosley. Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir?    You should take a look at this. The Henchman leads Thin Man into... SECURITY ROOM A room lined with monitors that survey the courtyard. Henchman points to one in the corner. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                  80. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See here? Look at the timer on the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not moving. (beat) Oh, this is the oldest one in the book. Punch up camera three. Another camera angle comes up, this also a view of the empty courtyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now pan left. The Henchman does what he's told and, on the monitor... WE SEE DYLAN, dressed in a black cat suit, as she rewires a security camera. She glances around, making sure no one sees her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old re-loop the video camera trick. And look, she's not even carrying a gun. (beat) What is this, amateur hour?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, excuse me?     I think you're trespassing. She whips around to see the Thin Man, standing right behind her. She instantly swings at him, he blocks it. She's about to swing again when five guns get cocked against her temple. She's surrounded by guards. NOW -- The thin man and his boys lead Dylan into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No offense, but as "storming the castle" plans go, this one sucked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah? And I suppose you could do better? (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                 81. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I sure as hell could.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about an underwater entry? Or hang gliding over the main tower? There's a million good ways in, if you just do your homework. Dylan glares at him, and as she does... We move in CLOSE ON Dylan's funky belt buckle.       There's a tiny camera concealed there. EXT. OUTSIDE THE COMPOUND - DAY Natalie and Alex huddle around a three-inch monitor, getting live video from Dylan's camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard the man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice work, Dyl. They move into action. EXT. SECOND STORY VERANDAH - DAY Dylan is led inside by the Thin Man.       Knox is waiting for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Present for you, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dylan, how nice. Welcome to my Florida home. Not as tasteful as the one in LA, but much more private. She shrugs off the goons -- enough already.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So tell me, Knox, what's the brilliant plan? You gonna sell a list of our foreign spies to the highest bidder? Blackmail the President?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first plan is too complicated, and the second is virtually impossible. (MORE) (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                 82. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Besides, I already have all the money I need and my motivation is much simpler... (leaning in close to her) ... revenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revenge?   Against who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? I'm not in a gabby mood right now. I've got a score to settle. He flips shut a suitcase filled with C-5 explosive, the same stuff we saw Pascal selling in the opening scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seems like you're going a bit overboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, just leaving myself plenty of margin for error. Goodbye, Dylan. With that, he walks out of the room. The Thin Man signals to the Henchmen. Two of them force Dylan to sit in one of the wooden deck chairs. Then, with the thick packing tape, they begin binding her arms to the arms of the chair. As they do:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know why you bother.   I've already won.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every moment I sit here is a moment I'm using to figure out how to take you down. In fact, this statement -- this one I'm making right here-- is just me stalling for time while I decide which of your goons I'm going to flatten first. (whispering) It's gonna be the guy behind me. The Thin Man can't help but be amused. After all, there are six guards and one blonde -- who is now taped to a chair. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                               83. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the time your guys are firing, I'll be at about 180 on my reverse inverted 360, which will land me on Fat Boy there, as promised. (nods to the second guard) He'll take the chair seat in the chin. (re: two others; very slowly) Now... I'm warning both of you: I'm going to get you to shoot each other. I know. Cliche as that sounds. (then to the last two) Last, you guys -- hell, I'll make something up. We'll have fun. The Thin Man smirks oh-so-confidently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what will you do to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't even be here. I mean, I don't want to tell you how to do your job, but you should've killed me by now. Because I already know that your people are onto my people, which means any moment now you're going to be called out to go and deal -- Suddenly the door flies open and -- DYLAN (CONT'D) Ah!   See?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have intruders. With a glare to Dylan, the Thin Man follows him out. INT. UNDERWATER GROTTO Alex, dressed in a sexy bikini, emerges from the water and instantly takes out two guards. EXT. SMALL GARDEN - DAY NATALIE hang-glides into a courtyard, knocking out two henchmen as she does. Alex catches up with her, as Natalie pulls out a small scanner. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                               84. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bosley's close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You find him.    I'll get Dylan. Natalie heads left.     Alex goes right. INT. TOWER OFFICE - DAY Racing up the stairs, Natalie enters a round room with open windows on all sides. A gentle breeze stirs the curtains. There's an amazing 360 degree view, from hills to ocean. According to her scanner, Bosley should be here, but there's no one.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. EGYPTIAN THEATRE - NIGHT A passing FILMGOER reveals Natalie and Pete. Seated near the aisle, they share a giant tub of popcorn. The movie hasn't started yet, but there's a slide show of various anime heroes and villains.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. KNOX'S HOUSE - NIGHT Dylan and Knox are asleep in his bed, when the doorbell CHIMES. Dylan bolts upright. She slips out of bed, peers out the window. Vivian Wu is waiting by the front door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. AIRPORT -- NIGHT A black sedan pulls onto the tarmac. Knox and Vivian Wu emerge, then hustle into a waiting private plane. INT. ANGELS DETECTIVE AGENCY Natalie, Dylan and Alex nurse their wounds and compare notes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. TOWNSEND AGENCY - DAY Alex is on the phone, frantically dialing numbers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. VILLA COURTYARD A HELICOPTER touches down inside the villa gates.     Knox and Vivian emerge. INT. COMPOUND - DAY Knox and Vivian walk into a fully macked computer room, where the Thin Man is supervising a techie as he taps away at Bosley's laptop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. COURTYARD - DAY Dylan sneaks her way through the courtyard, doing an admirable job of trying to stick to the walls. As she comes around the corner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! Bosley, can you hear me? INT. BOSLEY'S ROUND ROOM      DAY Hearing her voice, the feral Bosley looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie!   Is that you? INT. TOWER OFFICE - DAY She hears him. She keeps yelling -- so does he -- until they both realize that his room is above hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do I get up to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a staircase. Look for a switch. She begins frantically checking the desk, the shelves, everything. Her cell phone RINGS.     She answers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?... Pete, hi! How are you? INT. BILTMORE HOTEL - DAY On break, Pete is talking on a pay phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm good. I just -- you said you wanted me to call. CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                85. INT. TOWER OFFICE - DAY Natalie keeps checking the shelves, looking for a secret switch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did. I do.    I mean, thank you for calling. INTERCUT
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not an insecure person or anything, and I've really enjoyed the very brief time we have spent together. Two GOONS race up the stairs into the office.   Natalie turns to face them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just wondering if it's something I said or did that's making this whole thing so weird between us. The Goons approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) Can you hold on a sec? Hitting MUTE, Natalie kicks the chair behind her and dives under the desk. She comes up on the other side with a SURGE SUPPRESSOR, electric cords attached. She backhands it into the goons, who jerk and twitch as electricity shoots through their bodies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (un-muting) One more sec. She re-mutes. With a roundhouse kick, she flattens one of the goons, WHACKS the other with the cell phone. The first goon charges at her, but she sidesteps at the last moment, leaving Goon One to hit Goon Two. Both men topple through the open window, falling. Yikes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (un-muting) Sorry about that. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                              86. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, is this a bad time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.   Not at all. She starts searching again for the switch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just sound distracted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, work this week has been really busy. It's been hard to focus. BEHIND NATALIE, Vivian Wu reaches the top of the stairs. She moves stealthily. Natalie has no idea she's there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, the thing is, I'm not a full- time waitress. I should have been more up-front about that, it's just... At the last moment, Natalie catches a moving reflection in a shiny trophy. Turns to find Vivian Wu swinging an antique chair at her head. She ducks.    The chair SHATTERS the display case. Scrambling to get away, Natalie drops the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Natalie, what was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything's fine!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hate to disagree. Vivian upends the desk, nearly crushing Natalie. Vivian jumps on top, ready to kick the shit out of our angel. As we probably suspected, Vivian Wu is one hell of a martial artist. Fortunately, so is Natalie. In their first series of blows, Vivian seems to have the upper hand, but Natalie rallies hard. Vivian surprises her with a floor-sweeping kick, knocking her down. Vivian grabs the phone off the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this the famous Charlie? (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                87. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's Pete. Vivian looks at the phone. Who the fuck cares?      She throws the phone out the open window. Getting up, Natalie stares her down, incredulity building to rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bitch!   I like that guy. Mocking, Vivian wipes away a tear. Natalie lets forth a typhoon of fury, a full-out Mortal Kombat. Vivian is thrown back against the bookcase, where she knocks over a candlestick. That's the trigger for the bookcases to begin sinking into the floor. Circling around the room, each set of shelves drops to a different level, forming steps that lead to the upstairs room. As Natalie and Vivian continue to fight, Bosley sticks his head down from above, watching the brawl. Natalie is kicking ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any idea how difficult it is to find a quality man in Los Angeles? She slams Vivian into the wall.      Grabs her again, hands around her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To be honest? Vivian suddenly leans forward and KISSES her, right on the lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care. Natalie is surprised for a moment, which gives Vivian the chance to swing at her. She misses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can handle villainy. I can even handle super-villainy. (Vivian swings and misses again) But what you did is just wrong. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                              88. CONTINUED: She head-butts Vivian, knocking her out cold.   She throws the limp body on the floor. A beat, then Natalie looks up to see Bosley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Bos! He waves. EXT. VERANDAH - DAY From below, we hear SECURITY WHISTLES. The compound has been breached. Dylan looks at the six armed guards surrounding her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we go. And now she does exactly what she told the Thin Man she'd do: She pitches forward, ducking her head so the chair's back crashes into the railing, tearing it off. She stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, that part worked. The Guards FIRE -- but Dylan has already launched herself from the railing into that backflip, which lands her on the head of -- Fat Boy, flattening him bad, and smashing the rest of the chair into kindling. She grabs the wooden seat and whips it up, catching bullets from Guard #3 before flinging it like a Frisbee at Guard #2, nailing him right on the chin. Quickly she stands again, between Guards #3 and 4.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, guys, I warned you. This is where you shoot each other. The two men scoff, disbelieving. Then Dylan does a head fake, both Guards panic, and fire, but Dylan drops, leaving each man a clear shot at the other. Both gape. Both fall. Just Guards #5 and 6 left.    Dylan's chair arms are still taped to her forearms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, here's where we improvise. In a whirl, she overhead-chops Guard #5. Drives her right arm into his shoulder while swinging her left arm into the back of the Guard #6's head. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                   89. CONTINUED: A few more blows, then both men fall. Now Dylan drops into a second chair, half-exhausted, half-amused with herself. Has one brief beat to take it all in, then -- Bosley steps onto the veranda, sees Dylan sitting in the chair. FROM HIS POINT OF VIEW: It looks like Dylan -- whose arms are still strapped to the arms of the first chair -- is taped to the chair she now sits in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God, let me help you. Bosley hurries over, "freeing her." Amused, Dylan lets him. Natalie steps out from inside, pausing to KICK one guard who was starting to revive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. KNOX COMPOUND - DAY Knox, carrying the briefcase bomb, gets into his waiting helicopter, followed closely by the Thin Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's GO! The helicopter quick ascends, just as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn! THE THREE ANGELS run into the courtyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, we'll get him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't understand. He's got a pound of C-5 in that briefcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The question is, where's he headed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miami. The three angels turn to see Bosley, huffing and puffing his way into the courtyard. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                 90. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man Knox is trying to kill has two general admission tickets to the Duke- Maryland game at Miami Arena. He's going to blow up the arena and kill his target.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not that I don't believe you, but how exactly do you know all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because Angels, I was the one who purchased those tickets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Bosley, you HATE sports, why would you... (suddenly getting it) You didn't buy them for yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bought them for... Bosley lowers his head.    Suddenly all the angels understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! They race out the courtyard, in hot pursuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think he looks like? (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                   91. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixty, tall, well-built.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I always saw him as younger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Definitely.   With black hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, silver hair. And tan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not George Hamilton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's outside a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll know him when we see him, that's for sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: we see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How hard can it be to spot Charlie? They slam into the doors, and we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. MIAMI ARENA - NIGHT We reverse angle to reveal the inside of Miami Arena. The first thing that hits us is the WALL OF SOUND, the noise made by twenty thousand people in a basketball induced frenzy. The next thing that hits us is the sheer magnitude of the job facing the Angels. Hard to spot? The crowd is one, enormous, teeming mass of brightly colored humanity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, shit. The game is in progress, Duke vs. North Carolina, and it's a barn burner. A one point game with six minutes to go. BALL PLAYER pulls up and swishes a three pointer, Duke by two. The crowd goes apeshit. BY THE MEZZANINE The Angels huddle, yelling over the deafening noise of the crowd...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to split up! (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                               92. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take the luxury boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take the mezzanine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got the floor. They split up. Dylan leads the charge down the loge section, blowing past the SECURITY WOMAN, who yells after her. INT. ARENA FLOOR - NIGHT BEHIND THE RIM, COLLEGE PLAYER #2 pulls down a brick, slams home the rebound. The crowd ROARS. INT. LUXURY BOXES -- JASON GIBBONS, famous movie star and North Carolina alumnus, pumps his fists in the air. His luxury box is loaded with fellow Tar Heels and nameless studio executives. He repeatedly high fives a Hollywood type in sunglasses and Armani.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes! When suddenly, the door to the luxury box is flung open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie!? Charles Townsend! Jason whips around and locks eyes with Alex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason? (beat) Shit. Realizing she has no time to explain, and that Charlie isn't in here, she turns and leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !    Hey... While everyone watches, confused, Jason pushes his way through the box and follows Alex into the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking everywhere) Charlie! Charlie! FLASHES FIRE in the stands. STATISTICIANS scribble at their monitors. Natalie runs behind them, scanning the crowd. WHIP PANS, from ONE MAN to ANOTHER to ANOTHER. Stopping on a likely candidate...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? THE SCOREBOARD CLOCK counts down.    :60.   :59.    :58. INT. LUXURY BOXES - NIGHT Alex bursts in.   It's a crowd of fifteen cocktail-drinking BUSINESS MEN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charles Townsend? Anybody, Charles Townsend? She ducks back into the hallway. INT. HALLWAY -- CONTINUOUS Alex walks out into the hallway, frustrated.     Then, miraculously, she spots him... KNOX. He walks out of one of the luxury boxes, holding a large, metal briefcase. He heads for the elevator. ALEX immediately goes to intercept him, but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't move. (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                 94. CONTINUED: It's the Thin Man, standing behind her, with a gun in her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You move, you say anything, I perforate you. Got it? Knox glances back at the Thin Man, nods to him.      Then he gets in the elevator. The Thin Man starts edging Alex towards some emergency exit doors, gun still in her back. Alex is trying to think of an escape, quickly. She knows that the second he gets her out of this public space, he's gonna shoot her. The door gets closer and closer...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex?!   Jesus, what is going on? The Thin Man and Alex turn around to face Jason, who is sweaty and exasperated from chasing her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason, hi, I... The Thin Man digs the gun deeper into her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I talk to you later?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No you can talk to me NOW. I want to know what the hell is going on. First, you disappear with no explanation, not even a goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, I...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, I see you here, but you're with some other guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, movie star, do yourself a favor and get lost. Jason double takes.     He's not used to someone talking to him like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme guess.   You must be Charlie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason, please... (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                               95. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no I'm sick of this shit. I'm sick of this asshole telling you what you can and can't do. And then, with no warning, he hauls off and punches the Thin Man. Now, Jason's just an actor, not an ass-kicking super detective, so his punch isn't all that great. In fact, it leaves Jason shaking his hand in pain. The Thin Man, a trickle of blood running from his lip, smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was stupid. First, he pops Jason right in the jaw. Jason stumbles backward, dazed. Then he reaches for his gun, in the process, loosening his grip on Alex...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jason, get down! Alex spins out of the Thin Man's grasp and does a full roundhouse kick, knocking the gun out of the Thin Man's hands. The Thin Man immediately responds, throwing two quick punches, which Alex expertly blocks and then follows with a hitch-kick to the chin. Jason, dazed and confused, thinks he must be hallucinating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is going on? What's going on is a world class ass-kicking, courtesy of his girlfriend. While the action star watches in amazement, Alex unloads an arsenal of bad ass kung fu moves that would make Jet Li green with envy. The Thin Man doesn't stand a chance. A flying side kick sends him stumbling backwards into the stairwell. We follow the fight... INT. STAIRWELL -- CONTINUOUS ... to the first landing. The Thin Man, battered and bruised, reaches down to his ankle holster to get his spare gun, but Alex is too fast for him. She stamps on his hand, then drops a knee to his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right now, just by leaning forward, I could crush your windpipe. You'd die a slow and painful death. You don't want that, do you? (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                96. CONTINUED: The Thin Man shakes his head "no."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is the bomb, when's it going off? She presses harder. INT. HALLWAY Jason slams out into the stairwell, looking for Alex. He finds her on her walkie talkie, the Thin Man handcuffed to the staircase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Jason.   Gimme one second? Jason nods, sure. We go to another triptych, all three Angels on their cell phones in different parts of arena.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Angels! Knox planted the bomb in the basement, and it's timed to go off when the game clock hits zero!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roger that, Alex, I'll stop the clock!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll look for the bomb! Alex turns back to Jason. He's clearly having a difficult time processing everything he's just seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I lied to you Jason.    I'm not a secretary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I can see that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that wasn't Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm actually here to stop a madman from killing everyone in this building. Would it be okay if we talked later? (CONTINUED) CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                 97. CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go save the world, honey. (beat) I'll be waiting for you. Alex smiles.    Runs off. INT. ARENA Natalie stares up at the clock... :30.       :29. The WHISTLE BLOWS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time out! Whew, that was close. But it'll start up any second.       She has to keep it stopped. But how? She glances to the sidelines and gets an idea. ON THE COURT -- MUSIC starts from overhead, the respective teams' cheerleaders coming out for one last routine. As they kick into gear, Natalie comes out with them, dressed as a Duke cheerleader. She follows along with the dancers, a bit timid at first, then more confident as she gets into it. INT. ARENA BASEMENT -- BENEATH THE COURT Dylan races through the basement, looking for the briefcase. Then she spots it, hooked into some wires that snake up into ceiling above. Dylan approaches it cautiously.       She slowly opens the top...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, Dylan, all we have to do is figure out which wire to cut. REVEAL THE BOMB -- there are about fifty different wires, in every color in the Crayola box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit. INT. COURTSIDE Alex, still searching for Charlie, notices something strange.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're kidding me. CHARLIE'S ANGELS - 8/18/99                                98. NATALIE is fully transformed on the court, from wallflower to full- out cheerleader. It's not that she's as good as the other cheerleaders. She's better. ON THE COURT The SONG ends. The Cheerleaders vacate the court, but Natalie keeps dancing her heart out. She has 18,000 fans watching her, and she's totally in the moment. But there's another agenda as well...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The time out is over, but one cheerleader doesn't seem to notice. Officials can't start the clock again while she's on the court.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. MIAMI - DAY Racing across the water, we find thong-clad BEACH BABES moving to a Latin beat. Art Deco buildings flank sun-kissed streets. The people are sexy, the daiquiris strong, and every night's a fiesta -- Welcome to MIAMI. Running down the street, towards Miami Arena, the three angels pass THREE OTHER WOMEN rollerblading by: JILL MONROE, SABRINA DUNCAN and KELLY GARRETT. Nothing is said, but a cool moment just happened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. LONG, LONG, HALLWAY -- LATER The three Angels are running down a very long hallway. Their voices are the only sound that echoes off these walls, although there is a faint humming that grows louder as they approach two, metal fire doors.
dialogue.name: dialogue
